titles.title: Milk Marketing Order Reform Act of 1995

To amend the Agricultural Adjustment Act to repeal the minimum adjustments to prices of fluid milk under Federal marketing orders and to establish basing points in various geographical areas of the United States for purposes of determining prices to be paid to milk producers under such orders.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy and Poultry.

bill.summary: 6/8/1995--Introduced. Milk Marketing Order Reform Act of 1995 - Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act, reenacted with amendments by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937, to: (1) repeal current minimum fluid milk price adjustments; and (2) establish a regional milk pricing system.
